intro: Thesium microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
